results.title: Kill as we go
results.creator_credit: George E. Hughes, Ace Films and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Motor vehicles are a necessary part of Australian life - but they can kill. All road users should be educated to help reduce the road toll. Sponsored by the Australian Road Safety Council.

results.title: Kiko the kangaroo: red hot rhythm
results.brief_description: Animated film presenting Kiko the kangaroo. The orchestra in a broadcasting studio is playing red hot rhythm music. However the music is so hot that it actually sets the building alight. Kiko and his firemen come to the rescue to put out the fire.
results.description: Animated film presenting Kiko the kangaroo. The orchestra in a broadcasting studio is playing red hot rhythm music. However the music is so hot that it actually sets the building alight. Kiko and his firemen come to the rescue to put out the fire.

results.title: Kiko the kangaroo: Kiko at the bat = Play ball
results.creator_credit: Mannie Davis, Paul Terry and Terry Toons
results.brief_description: It’s the day of the much anticipated ball-game between Kiko’s Australian Champs and the Jungle Giants. The battle begins and the advantage shifts from team to team until fortune smiles upon the Champs and honesty is rewarded with victory.

results.title: Kiko the kangaroo: hail the king
results.creator_credit: George Gordon, Mannie Davis, Paul Terry, Castle Films and Terrytoons
results.brief_description: Kiko cooks a chicken for the king who has just been coronated but unfortunately the king disapproves and Kiko is sent off to the tower as punishment. Or is this all just a dream! No dialogue - music soundtrack only.

results.title: Kids making decisions
results.creator_credit: Tony Paice, Corporate Relations Unit and Victoria. Inner City School Support Centre
results.brief_description: A program for primary teachers highlighting key features in developing integrated curriculum. An integrated curriculum goes beyond a thematic approach and involves coordinating all curriculum areas around one chosen topic to promote the development of learning. Shows teachers and their classes in three Western Metropolitan schools involved in choosing a topic, ordering concept areas and contributing questions. The pupils are involved by taking responsibility for their own learning in making key decisions.

results.title: Kids do yoga too
results.creator_credit: Cathy Henkel, Michael Murray, Nick Jeanes, Lightsource Films, Naam Productions and Wild Releasing
results.brief_description: Introduce your children to the gentle art of yoga with this colourful and enjoyable video, filmed on the beach and in the Australian rainforest. With the use of poetry, playful illustrations and the help of seven children, yoga teacher Rachel Zinman demonstrates 18 Australian animal postures to show how easy and how much fun yoga can be. This exercise program is presented in two sections of approximately 15 minutes each, so that it can be broken into smaller parts for practice in the home. It is designed for children aged 5-12 and parents should take care to adhere to the cautionary warnings at the beginning of the tape.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cathy Henkel, Michael Murray, Nick Jeanes, Lightsource Films, Naam Productions and Wild Releasing

results.title: Kids and drugs
results.brief_description: Australian documentary aimed at primary school children, dealing with the 4 most common drugs in our society: 1. Medicines, prescription and non-prescription. 2. Alcohol. 3. Tobacco. 4. Cannabis/Marijuana. The program’s young presenter explores the question “what is a drug?” and the notions of legal/illegal, harmful/helpful drugs. She interviews primary school children, a pharmacist, winemaker, doctor and policemen, drawing on a wide range of perceptions, questions and information. The result is a comprehensive “discussion” of these drugs. A good drug education video, suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Related topic = peer pressure.
